alert.note: Alert for Northern Fulton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 3:10PM EST until February 23 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of New York and southern Vermont, including the following areas, in New York, Hamilton, Montgomery, Northern Fulton, Northern Herkimer, Northern Warren, Northern Washington, Southern Fulton and Southern Herkimer. In southern Vermont, Bennington, Eastern Windham and Western Windham. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The combination of some snowmelt and 0.75 to 2.00 inches of rain late today into tonight will lead to rises on rivers and streams. Some localized flooding is possible, especially in the vicinity of existing ice jams. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
